intro: Fedia orientalis, commonly known as the oriental fedia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and prefers well-drained, loamy soil. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Fedia orientalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has mild medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
